title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 451.66 - Cost allocation
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 451.66 - Cost allocation

State Regulations

The apportionment or allocation of the costs of
nonrevenue-producing cost centers to each other, and to revenue-producing
centers on the basis of the statistical data that measure the amount of service
rendered by each center to other centers. The purpose of cost allocation is to
determine the total of full costs of operating each revenue-producing center of
a health facility. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10
ยง
451.66

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
